title: 104_hr1941
content:
Section 4301(a)(2) of title 38, United States Code, is amended by removing "under honorable conditions". Section 4303 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to clarify definitions related to work performed and national emergencies. Discrimination against persons who serve in the uniformed services and acts of reprisal are prohibited. Section 4311 of title 38, United States Code, prohibits employers from discriminating against individuals who enforce protections, testify, assist in investigations, or exercise rights under this chapter. The prohibition applies regardless of military service. Section 4311 of title 38, United States Code, prohibits employer discrimination based on membership, application for service, or obligation in the uniformed services. Employers cannot take adverse actions if these factors are motivating factors, unless they can prove otherwise. The prohibitions in subsections (a) and (b) of Section 4311 of title 38, United States Code, apply to any position of employment, including those described in section 4312(d)(1)(C). SEC. 4. REEMPLOYMENT RIGHTS OF PERSONS WHO SERVE IN THE UNIFORMED SERVICES. Section 4312 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to include preparation and travel time prior to service, limit service exemption to war or national emergency, and address brief, nonrecurrent periods of service. Section 4312 of title 38, United States Code is amended to address brief, nonrecurrent periods of service by making conforming amendments to redesignations in Title 10. SEC. 5. REEMPLOYMENT POSITIONS. Amends Section 4313(a)(4) of title 38, United States Code by correcting a typographical error and clarifying the qualifications for reemployment positions. SEC. 6. HEALTH PLANS. Addresses health plans in the context of the amendments made in the previous sections. SEC. 6. HEALTH PLANS. Amends Section 4317(a) of title 38, United States Code by restructuring and redesignating clauses for health plans. SEC. 7. EMPLOYEE PENSION BENEFIT PLANS. Modifies the last sentence of section 4318(b)(2) of title 38, United States Code regarding payment periods for services. SEC. 8. ENFORCEMENT OF EMPLOYMENT OR REEMPLOYMENT RIGHTS. SEC. 8. ENFORCEMENT OF EMPLOYMENT OR REEMPLOYMENT RIGHTS. Amends section 4322(d) of title 38, United States Code by adding "attempt to" before "resolve." Also, modifies section 4322(e) by changing language related to complaints filed under subsection (a) and adding "or the Office of Personnel Management" after "Federal executive agency." SEC. 9. ENFORCEMENT OF RIGHTS WITH RESPECT TO A STATE OR PRIVATE EMPLOYER. Amends section 4323(a) of title 38, United States Code by removing language related to unsuccessful complaint resolution and updating references to section 4322(a).

SEC. 10. ENFORCEMENT OF RIGHTS WITH RESPECT TO FEDERAL EXECUTIVE AGENCIES. SEC. 10. ENFORCEMENT OF RIGHTS WITH RESPECT TO FEDERAL EXECUTIVE AGENCIES. Amends section 4324 of title 38, United States Code by updating referral and alternative complaint submission procedures, as well as relief provisions. SEC. 11. Amends Section 4325(d)(1) of title 38, United States Code by removing certain phrases and updating language for clarity. SEC. 12. Updates Section 4326(a) of title 38, United States Code to ensure investigators have access to relevant information. SEC. 13. Addresses transition rules and effective dates. Reemployment rights under the Uniformed Services Employment and Reemployment Rights Act of 1994 are amended to include service up to 60 days after the date of enactment of the Act. Service under specific orders issued under section 502(f) of title 32, United States Code, will be considered under the previous law if served within the specified timeframe. The Uniformed Services Employment and Reemployment Rights Act of 1994 is amended to include service up to 60 days after the date of enactment. The amendment also changes the language regarding insurance coverage for individuals serving in the uniformed services. The amendments made by the Uniformed Services Employment and Reemployment Rights Act of 1994 shall take effect on October 13, 1994, with specific references in Title 10 taking effect on December 1, 1994.
